projectPurpose: To provide a Rust implementation of a full node for the Fuel v2 protocol, enabling users to connect to, interact with, and validate the Fuel network, a modular execution layer for Ethereum rollups.
mainFeatures: Full node for Fuel v2 protocol
Enables participation in Fuel network validation

alternatives.name: Geth (Go Ethereum)
mainFeatures: Supports various sync modes (full, light, archive)
Largest user base among Ethereum clients

alternatives.name: Nethermind
mainFeatures: Optimized virtual machine and state access

alternatives.name: Reth (Rust Ethereum)
mainFeatures: Focus on modularity, performance, and efficiency
Suitable for staking and high-uptime services
Compatible with Ethereum consensus layer clients via Engine API

alternatives.name: Arbitrum
mainFeatures: Aims for low costs and high throughput

marketPositioning: Fuel Core is positioned as the foundational node software for the Fuel Network, a novel modular execution layer designed specifically for scaling Ethereum. Unlike traditional Layer 1 nodes (like Geth, Nethermind, or Reth) that focus on the base chain, or typical Layer 2 solutions (like Arbitrum or OP Mainnet) that often rely on EVM compatibility, Fuel differentiates itself with its custom-built FuelVM and Sway programming language. This unique stack aims to unlock higher performance, parallel transaction execution, and a more flexible development environment tailored for the future of decentralized applications. Fuel Core is therefore positioned not just as *another* node implementation, but as the entry point to a distinct and highly optimized Layer 2 ecosystem.
